name: Vegan Baked Onion Rings
author: vegmomandkids2
summary: These onion rings are vegan and baked, not deep-fried! Quick and delicious for a snack or side dish, these onion rings have great flavor with less fat and calories than a traditional recipe. Add spices as you desire.
ingredients: extra-virgin olive oil cooking spray (such as Pam®)
2  sweet onions (such as Vidalia®), cut into 1/4-inch slices and separated into rings
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray generously with cooking spray
Pour coconut milk into a bowl and stir in apple cider vinegar
Let sit until thickened, about 5 minutes
Add onions; soak until 'buttermilk' clings to onions, about 5 minutes
Mix cornmeal, flour, sesame seeds, salt, garlic powder, paprika, and pepper together in a shallow dish
Take onion rings out of the buttermilk one by one with a fork and drop on top of the cornmeal mixture
Lift coated rings onto the sprayed foil and space them apart
Spray the top of the rings with cooking spray
Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes
Flip rings over and bake until dark golden, about 5 minutes more
